10.name: Cash Cow
10.describe: The Cash Cow worked its way out of the bull pen to get to where it is today.

11.name: Revive Raven
11.describe: Rarest of the rare. A bird like this comes along once in a lifetime.

12.name: Lucky Lamb
12.describe: With the Lucky Lamb in your zoo, you'll have a lot more luck finding rare animals out there in the stampede.

13.name: Mission Mule
13.describe: This military workhorse will keep you on mission.

101.name: Cape Buffalo
101.describe: The African buffalo or Cape buffalo, is a large African bovine

102.name: Forest Buffalo
102.describe: A smaller variety of buffalo, which is brown like the trees

103.name: Water Buffalo
103.describe: These domestic buffalo are more chilled than their wild cousins

104.name: Bison
104.describe: Bison are big, tough and need a haircut

105.name: Kerfuffle'o
105.describe: A bold new designer buffalo on the runway this season. It has caused quite a stir.

106.name: Diabuffalo
106.describe: Prepare yourself, mortal. This is one spicy meatball.

108.name: Buff the Magic Dragon
108.describe: Buff the Magic Dragon lives in the zoo, frolicks in the Savannah when stampeding with you.

121.name: Zebra
121.describe: Originally thought to be a white horse with black markings. To a zebra, stripes are always flattering.

122.name: Reverzebra
122.describe: The backwards cousin of a zebra

123.name: Candicorn
123.describe: Prime suspect in an increasing trend of lions with diabetes.

125.name: Punky Zeb
125.describe: This is one zebra that doesn't follow the herd

126.name: Electro Zebra
126.describe: On the run after escaping from a retro arcade game.

128.name: Zegasus
128.describe: This zebra is just like Pegasus but with stripes, for better visibility in the air.

129.name: Merry-go-round
129.describe: They prefer giving rides to children over roaming the Savannah.

141.name: African Elephant
141.describe: Elephants are the best way to go if you need something smashed

142.name: Mammoth
142.describe: Bigger than elephants, stronger than elephants, hairier than elephants, though they have some minor troubles with extinction.

143.name: The King
143.describe: The most civilized elephant you'll meet

144.name: Psychedelephant
144.describe: This elephant never let the man keep it down

145.name: Tootephant
145.describe: This one time at band camp...

146.name: Jellephant
146.describe: In the elephant graveyard hyenas are the last thing you should be worrying about

147.name: Fire Hydrophant
147.describe: Parking in front of this will cost you!

148.name: Jellephant
148.describe: The Peanut Butter Jellephant is the healthiest member of the Lunchodonta genus.

149.name: Santa's Big Helper
149.describe: This Elf-ephant does all the heavy lifting.

161.name: Ostrich
161.describe: Ostriches only have one response to all their problems... Running

162.name: Celebirdy
162.describe: A snippy snooty fancy prancy blue-blooded bird. It simply must hog all the attention.

163.name: Glam Rockstrich
163.describe: Its parents insisted it settle down, get a haircut and a real job. But some ostriches just wanna have fun.

164.name: Ostri Chevalier
164.describe: Noble, gallant, chivalrous. Prefers tournaments to war for lifestyle reasons.

166.name: Bosstrich
166.describe: Nobody likes the Bosstrich but everyone pretends to

167.name: Mosstrich
167.describe: Rocks an impressive mosstache, but smells kinda fungi.

168.name: Ostwitch
168.describe: Rides the fastest broom in the Savannah, but has a tendency to fly off the handle.

181.name: Giraffe
181.describe: Up to 6m high, the tallest of all animals. With their long bendy neck, they are nature's own catapult.

182.name: Girafferty
182.describe: A restored vintage model from the late 18th century: the coal-powered giraffe.

183.name: Taco Jirafa
183.describe: A tall order. Best served with salsa, guacamole, hotsauce and la música!

184.name: Highballer
184.describe: Slam dunks look easy from up there.

185.name: Giraxxus
185.describe: A good friend of the Diabuffalo, they often hang together at conventions.

186.name: UFG
186.describe: Nobody knows the truth about its origins, but we're pretty sure the government is behind it.

188.name: World's Tallest Sheep
188.describe: This giraffe really has its head up in the clouds.

189.name: Giraffemas Tree
189.describe: Gifts are left at this giraffe's feet and it can't work out why.

201.name: Vulture
201.describe: They scavenge far and wide to find their meals, but insist on travelling light. They only fly with carrion baggage.

202.name: Egyptian Vulture
202.describe: Unlike their folically challenged cousins, this species discovered a miracle hair growth formula.

203.name: Viva Las Vulture
203.describe: The Savannah Strip's premier Elvis impersonator.

204.name: Vulture Captialist
204.describe: "Why is nobody thanking me for saving these dying companies?"

205.name: Pop Vulture
205.describe: This vulture is a big deal in Japan

206.name: Vulture-on
206.describe: Vulture-on is actually made up of many tiny robot vultures.

207.name: Dracorian
207.describe: Resembles a graceful bird of paradise. Is actually a prehistoric lizard.

208.name: Volture
208.describe: This high voltage bird has a lot of potential. Keep out of water.

209.name: Scarecrow
209.describe: The Scarecrow can't figure out why other birds keep avoiding them.

221.name: Lion
221.describe: Second-largest of the big cats, but they're endowed with the animal kingdom's most glorious hair.

222.name: Dande Lion
222.describe: The world's rarest and most feared carnivorous plant. Don't get too close, this ain't no pussywillow.

223.name: Sabretooth Lion
223.describe: This was totally a thing, right?

224.name: Gryphon
224.describe: A mythical beast of epic origins, or a festive kitty in a homemade costume.

225.name: Le' Ion Chef
225.describe: A world renowned chef, be sure to try the anti-pasto-lope.

226.name: Cryin' Lion
226.describe: A failed circus clown, still recovering from the embarassment.

227.name: Massai Lion
227.describe: Adolescent tribal lions hunt people in groups as a rite of passage.

228.name: Sea Lion
228.describe: The notorious pirate captain Blackmane is the scourge of the high seas. An incredibly skilled sailor despite an intense fear of water.

229.name: Nian Monster
229.describe: Most commonly found dancing in lines in China.  Scare it away with fireworks.

241.name: Wild Boar
241.describe: Boars remove parasites by rolling in mud, so the mud infact makes them cleaner, not dirtier.

242.name: Indian Boar
242.describe: Known for its long mane and dark coat.

243.name: Boaring
243.describe: It was not the coolest piglet at boar-ding school.

244.name: Borc
244.describe: The Boaring plays videogames featuring the Borc, and even dresses up like one at conventions.

245.name: Beautiful Boar
245.describe: This is what really happens when you throw pearls before swine.

246.name: Hog Rider
246.describe: Loves to hit the open road.

247.name: Wild Snore
247.describe: Uproarious, but cannot hear itself and thus sleeps soundly.

248.name: BoarBQ
248.describe: It's as if bacon, ham and pork all come from one magical animal...

249.name: Frankenswine
249.describe: This lab grown meat is more than the sum of its parts.

261.name: Western Gorilla
261.describe: Its powerful arms allow it to vault over obstacles and lay the smackdown. Truly a great ape.

262.name: Mountain Gorilla
262.describe: An increasingly rare breed. Some say a good coif makes for an even greater ape.

264.name: Guerilla
264.describe: Considered a pest in many parts of the world.

265.name: Lawrilla
265.describe: Impartial to everything except bananas. Lawrilla loves bananas.

266.name: Volcanorilla
266.describe: Volcanorilla's explosive nature presents a challenge when living in a rainforest.

267.name: Thorilla
267.describe: Does Thorilla look to be in a gaming mood?

281.name: Alligator
281.describe: Knows a thing or two about eating.

282.name: Frogator
282.describe: Significantly better at jumping than the average alligator.

283.name: Snorkadile
283.describe: Always gets the entire beach to itself for some reason. Just lucky I guess.

284.name: Bunny Gator
284.describe: Uses its cute appearance to lure in its prey.

285.name: Bridezilla
285.describe: It's the snappiest day of her life.

286.name: Cockadoodile
286.describe: Part sleepy cold blooded lizard, part early rising rooster. Mornings are a challenge.

287.name: Crookodile
287.describe: Never smile at a Crookodile, lest it rob you of that smile...

289.name: Investi-Gator
289.describe: For some reason, all the evidence from this detective's cases are covered in teeth marks.

301.name: Hippo
301.describe: For an animal that can't swim, they sure love the water.

302.name: Pygmy Hippo
302.describe: Like a teacup pig, Africa style.

303.name: Ballerina Hippo
303.describe: The most graceful of the hippos. Walks en pointe.

304.name: Hip Hop Hippo
304.describe: Goes by the stage name Notorious H.I.P.P.O.

305.name: Hippiepotamus
305.describe: Hippiepotamus is still living in the 70's.

306.name: Platypotamus
306.describe: And you thought a platypus was a weird animal.

307.name: Taweret
307.describe: An ancient being known as "the great one, lardy of heaven, retainer of waters."

308.name: Sabretooth Hippo
308.describe: Despite appearances, the most terrifying end of this hippo is the rear.

321.name: Rhino
321.describe: Rhinos love to smash stuff, they just take a while to get going.

322.name: Hawaiino
322.describe: Loves dancing by firelight, and hangin' three toes up on the Malibu.

323.name: Apple Pieno
323.describe: Keeps in great shape on a cinnamon diet. Going extinct 'cause it smells too delicious...

324.name: Feline'o
324.describe: When combined with a laser pointer, this becomes a lethal weapon.

325.name: Skynoceros
325.describe: Unfortunately these wings don't provide quite enough lift for takeoff...

326.name: Dhinoceros
326.describe: Like many Rhinosaurs, the Dhinoceros is in grave danger of extinction.

327.name: Marcel Rhineau
327.describe: Has perfected the art of mime by silently rampaging through the jungle.

328.name: Slimenoceros
328.describe: Has a runny nose. Its sneeze could level a city block.

341.name: Tiger
341.describe: Largest of all cats, Tigers were unfairly overlooked when Lions got awarded 'king of the jungle'.

342.name: Liger
342.describe: Bred for its skills and magic.

344.name: White Tiger
344.describe: The favourite animal of super villains the world over.

346.name: Tiger Lily
346.describe: The most beautiful of all the tigers.

347.name: Pink Panthera
347.describe: Otherwise known as the famous "Inspector Pusseau".

348.name: Tigermoth
348.describe: Don't leave the lights on when you go camping...

349.name: Santa Claws
349.describe: Loves to deliver presents but always gets distracted by the wrapping paper.

361.name: Toucan
361.describe: A toucan's bill can account for up to 50% of its entire body surface area.

362.name: Hornbill
362.describe: Not actually a type of toucan. A bird can dream though.

363.name: Bluecan
363.describe: The offical mascot of the blue man group.

364.name: Moocan
364.describe: Despite being a jungle dwelling bird, it longs for the rolling hills of the countryside.

365.name: Brewcan
365.describe: Finally a way for birds to drink from a can.

367.name: Kazoocan
367.describe: In your sky zoo-can be heard these rare toucans. Amazing the songs you-can sing with Kazoocans.

368.name: Bazookan
368.describe: Lightweight, portable, anti-tank bird of prey.
